intro: Eustoma russellianum f. bicolor, commonly known as the blue and white lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking bicolor flowers, which typically feature blue petals with white centers. The plant belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is known for its compact growth habit and long blooming period. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is widely cultivated in gardens for its beauty and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
